p: The slurry was siphoned into 1.2 L of water containing 1.5 equivalents of NaHCO 3, thus obtaining a fine dispersion of a dark green product (no heat evolution was observed). The slurry was then filtered on a G3 frit, washed with water, dried in air under moderate vacuum, then in the rotating evaporator at 80°C and finally under high vacuum (mechanical pump).
